column2: ENGLISH
Fimir Culture Modifier
Albion Culture Modifier
Wolf Hunt
Word has reach you that a pack of wolves are terrorizing a local village, so the freemen demand that you uphold your oath and drive them off.
Ready my hunters!
I do this alone.
Let the rabble handle it.
Strange Tidings

Early in the morning, you and a band of your closest warriors are hunting a stag, along the way you stumble upon an idol to Tchar. Your companions are scouting ahead of you when the idol begins speaking to you, promising absolute power and dominion over all others, if you only worship him...
Tchar is known to be a trickster...
I shall be a willing servant to Tchar, Changer of Ways!
Bloody Visions

Lately, you've noticed yourself becoming more and more aggressive, and constantly craving for battle and glory. Your slumber is disturbed when Kharneth, the Blood God, demands that you join his ranks, and forever live in glory.
Glory in battle is a fine thing, but I shall earn it myself.
Yes... Yes! Blood for the Blood God!
Beautiful Voices

You are walking through your hall during a slow day. After participating in a great feast and round of drinking that would make a legendary tale in itself, you still feel empty inside, like something is missing. Soon, you begin hearing voices, beautiful ones, calling to you, asking you to give yourself to Shornaal so that you may be satisfied...
And end up a decadent sluggard? I think not!
More... More of everything!
Decay and Ruin

In your dreams Nurgleth, Lord of Death and Decay calls to you... 'The world is falling, it is corrupt, dying... embrace it, my child... embrace your destiny...' you hear a voice calling, and maggots crawl up from the ground, greeting you...
Wreck and ruin to Nurgleth, I shall make my own way!
May the corpse trail grow long!
True Evil

In your dreams, spirits of all shapes and forms come to you... You recognise many of them, and they press on you, whispering forbidden secrets and promises of power. They demand that you cast off the deities and guardians that have guided you your whole life and devote yourself entirely to the real gods of this world, the Dark Gods of Chaos Undivided: Khorne, Nurgle, Tzeentch & Slaanesh.
My oaths to my kin and my gods are too important to betray!
For the Ruinous Powers!
You have decided to abandon the traditional gods of the Norscan faith, as they have done little for you, in favour of the Chaos Gods, which shall you follow?
All of them, for the Dark Gods! For Chaos!
I feel a rage unequalled in the mortal realm... Blood for the Blood God!
Slaanesh will grant me my desires.
There are others...
Here are the others
This world reeks of death, Nurgle will see me safe.
Everyone is out to get me, but Tzeentch shall show me the way.
Nevermind.
Convert to Chaos
Embrace the Dark gods
Conversion
Choose a patron god
We pay homage to many gods... I would surely benefit by choosing one as my patron.
We Norscans worship many gods, perhaps we should adopt a single one as our patron and enjoy benefits?
Promote Tchar
Promote Kjörn
Promote Nierg
There are others...
Here are the others.
Promote Loesh
Promote Olric
Promote Órsen
On second thought...
Patron of Tchar
Patron of Kjörn
Patron of Nierg
Patron of Loesh
Patron of Olric
Patron of Órsen
Troll Country
Quest to become Chosen
Quest to become Champion
Quest to become Chosen, the first step on the path to ruin!
Quest to become Champion, the next step on the path to ruin!
Chosen are minor champions that have won small favours from their gods, you may quest to become one yourself.
Yes, I shall earn favour from the gods!
Chosen Duel

The gods have heard your plea, and have answered. Following the instructions delivered in the entrails of your servant, you find yourself in a twisted grove of otherworldly trees. A hulking beast of malformed flesh and bone claws its way through to the clearing and roars a challenge to you. You're not sure if it's a former champion who succumbed to their corruption, or some unfortunate beast that was twisted by the gods, but it's definitely hostile. Defeat the creature, and gain your infamy!
Charge! For the Dark Gods!
Perhaps I will come back later?
Victory!

The beast is huge and possesses immense strength, but is slow and witless. It is a simple matter to dodge the clumsy blows and strike it repeatedly as it bellows and lurches at you. Finally, after countless strikes, the creature lets out a forlorn cry and collapses in a pool of its own blood. You emerge victorious, and thus may be granted your gift from the gods...
I am the greatest!
Failure!

You thought you had won, but your smugness turns to horror when the monster's fury increases and catches you off guard in a careless moment. Now, you lie in a pool of blood, becoming a meal, not a Chosen.
No! Not... Not like this!
Quest Finished

After returning home from your victory, word has spread of your deed, now a band of hopeful warriors has arrived at your hold, pledging service to you as their rightful leader. They expect you to lead them to greater glories and triumphs.
Good... Now on to grander things...
We have broken the lizardman forces defending this settlement, and have looted a small amount of valuables from their structures.
We can do better.
We have broken the lizardman forces defending this settlement, and have looted a good amount of valuables from their structures.
Perfect!
We have broken the lizardman forces defending this settlement, and have looted a large amount of valuables from their structures.
Excellent!
We have broken the lizardman forces defending this settlement, and have successfully looted their temple!
Perfect!
Disaster has struck! While you were leading a group of warriors to the city centre, you were ambushed by a group of Saurian warriors, wounding you severely!
Now is a good to time retreat before more come...
Disaster! While leading your raiders on an assault on the lizardman settlement, you have been critically wounded!
No! I can still fight!

Ambush! While looting a lizardman stronghold you find yourself surrounded by Saurian warriors who don't appreciate your actions. Though you fight valiantly they overwhelm you, but before they finish you off your companions break through and rescue you.
No! Save me my comrades!
The jungle can take it's toll on outsiders, you have caught a sickness while traversing the ancient jungles of Lustria.
What do you mean? I feel fine!

Your greed has gotten the best of you, while attempting to reach the very heart of the lizardman city, you encounter what appears to be the honour guards defending the temple. You fight boldly, but in the end, you are defeated by their superior strength and numbers, and have fallen in combat.
My family must avenge me!
Your raids have paid off big now, as your warriors bring to you a strange Old Ones artifact.
Excellent. I wonder what secrets this object holds?
The gods have noticed your bravery and boldness, you can feel them watching you now!
I had best not screw up now, then.

Unlike the southerners, Northern realms barely recognize the heredity concepts of the south. Being a follower of Khorne, you must be strong and blood-thirsty in order to gain the respect of the clans, something you are not.

Unlike the southerners, Northern realms barely recognize the heredity concepts of the south, where only the strong may lead. You have been deemed a weak indiviual by the clans, and thus they refuse to recognise your authority.

Unlike the southerners, Northern realms barely recognize the heredity concepts of the south. Being a follower of Slaanesh, you must woo and impress your clansmen to gain their respect, something you are incapable of doing.

Unlike the southerners, Northern realms barely recognize the heredity concepts of the south. Being a follower of Tzeentch, you must be be intelligent, skilled in statecraft, or have some skill in magic, but you have none of these.

Unlike the southerners, Northern realms barely recognize the heredity concepts of the south. Being a follower of Nurgle, you must be kind and charitable, spreading Nurgle's love to all, but you are greedy, and keep Nurgle's joys to yourself.
Alas, it is as the gods demand it.

Unlike the southerners, Northern realms barely recognize the heredity concepts of the south, and as such, unless the heir is clearly favored by their gods, the realm will dissolve on the leaders death. Your heir currently does not show any favor at all, and unless they were to improve, your realm will dissolve upon your death.
I must shape them up before I die...
I am aware of my culture's traditions, bother me no more of this!

For your heir to retain any High Lordships or higher they must be an adult and have one of the following:
-Prestige or Piety higher than 666
-Skills above 15. khornates, undivided, and norscans like martial, Slaanesh diplomacy, Nurgle stewardship, and Tzeentch learning
\n-You will not be bothered about your heir again...\n
